Description: Mechanisms exist to display cybersecurity and data protection attributes in human-readable form on each object that the system transmits to output devices to identify special dissemination, handling or distribution instructions using human-readable, standard naming conventions.
Justification: The input requires encryption of corporate laptops and mobile devices, which aligns with DCH-05.5's requirement to display cybersecurity and data protection attributes on transmitted objects.

Description: Mechanisms exist to protect mobile devices from tampering through inspecting devices returning from locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk, prior to the device being connected to the organization's network.
Justification: The input prohibits storing unencrypted company data on personal devices, which aligns with MDM-04's requirement to protect mobile devices from tampering.

Description: Mechanisms exist to treat all users and devices as potential threats and prevent access to data and resources until the users can be properly authenticated and their access authorized.
Justification: The input requires reporting lost or stolen devices to initiate remote wipe protocols, which aligns with NET-01.1's requirement to treat all users and devices as potential threats and prevent access to data and resources until authenticated and authorized.
